LTTextBox.text: The instrument also applies Earth Tide Correction to its final gravity reading at each station.
The gravity values for this survey are related to the Australian Gravity Base Station Network using
the ISOGal84 (ISGN71) values at known gravity stations as provided by DOIR. All gravity values
are  expressed  in  units  of  milligals.  The  field  gravity  observations  have  been  processed  using
standard  formulae  and  constants  to  produce  Bouguer  Anomaly  values.  The  Bouguer  correction
All Data and results of the gravity processing are included in Appendix 2.
In  2004,  a  lag  sampling  geochemical  program  was  undertaken  on  leases  in  the  Windimurrra
Project area. Deflation lag samples (-6 + 2mm) were taken in areas of good lag, with magnetic lags
taken  where  the  lag  sampling  medium  was  poor.  A  total  of  31  samples  were  taken  from  the
relinquished  portion  of  the  lease  near  Boodanoo,  comprising  29  magnetic  lag  samples  and  2
deflation  lag  samples.  These  samples  were  analysed  for  (ppm  detection  limit  in  brackets)  by
V(2), Zn(1). The results are included in Appendix 3 and sample locations are depicted in Figure 7.
Most of the samples were taken at a spacing of 500m x 200m, with a small area of 250m x 100m
to cope with limitations of the granted lease area. The maximum nickel returned in the relinquished
area was 42ppm (with 24ppm Cu, 36.6% Fe). There were no geochemical anomalies in the area
sampled. The majority of the area to be relinquished is associated with salt lakes, and geochemical
sampling was not carried as it was decided that it would not be effective.
The  Narndee  and  Windimurra  Intrusive  complexes  have  been  interpreted  as  large,  layered
intrusions of gabbro, anorthosite, pyroxenite, peridotite and magnetic cumulates. The Narndee and
Mulyeron Hill areas are interpreted as having greater potential for nickel sulphide mineralisation.
The  area  to  be  relinquished does not appear to contain prospective ground for the discovery of
